actions.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

official_title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that the United States Government should encourage other governments to draft and participate in regional treaties aimed at avoiding any adverse impacts on the physical environment or environmental interests of other nations or a global commons area, through the preparation of Environmental Impact Assessments, where appropriate.

summary.text: Calls on the U.S. Government to encourage the governments of other nations to form regional treaties regarding transboundary activities which may have an adverse impact on the environment of other nations or on a global commons area. Encourages regional treaties to ensure that activities are undertaken in environmentally sound ways to minimize adverse effects.
